verses.verse: Hear <WH8085> ye<WH853> the word<WH1697> which<WH834> the LORD<WH3068> speaketh<WH1696> unto<WH5921> you, O house<WH1004> of Israel: <WH3478>

Thus <WH3541> saith<WH559> the LORD,<WH3068> Learn<WH3925> not<WH408> the way<WH1870> of the heathen,<WH1471> and be not<WH408> dismayed<WH2865> at the signs<WH4480> <WH226> of heaven;<WH8064> for<WH3588> the heathen<WH1471> are dismayed<WH2865> at them.<WH4480> <WH1992>

For <WH3588> the customs<WH2708> of the people<WH5971> are vain:<WH1892> for<WH3588> one cutteth<WH3772> a tree<WH6086> out of the forest,<WH4480> <WH3293> the work<WH4639> of the hands<WH3027> of the workman,<WH2796> with the axe.<WH4621>
They deck<WH3302> it with silver<WH3701> and with gold;<WH2091> they fasten<WH2388> it with nails<WH4548> and with hammers,<WH4717> that it move<WH6328> not.<WH3808>

They <WH1992> are upright<WH4749> as the palm tree,<WH8560> but speak<WH1696> not:<WH3808> they must needs be borne,<WH5375> <WH5375> because<WH3588> they cannot<WH3808> go.<WH6805> Be not<WH408> afraid<WH3372> of<WH4480> them; for<WH3588> they cannot<WH3808> do evil,<WH7489> neither<WH369> also<WH1571> is it in<WH854> them to do good.<WH3190>
Forasmuch as there is none<WH4480> <WH369> like unto thee,<WH3644> O LORD;<WH3068> thou<WH859> art great,<WH1419> and thy name<WH8034> is great<WH1419> in might.<WH1369>

Who <WH4310> would not<WH3808> fear<WH3372> thee, O King<WH4428> of nations?<WH1471> for<WH3588> to thee doth it appertain:<WH2969> forasmuch<WH3588> as among all<WH3605> the wise<WH2450> men of the nations,<WH1471> and in all<WH3605> their kingdoms,<WH4438> there is none<WH4480> <WH369> like unto thee.<WH3644>
But they are altogether<WH259> brutish<WH1197> and foolish:<WH3688> the stock<WH6086> is a doctrine<WH4148> of vanities.<WH1892>

Silver <WH3701> spread into plates<WH7554> is brought<WH935> from Tarshish,<WH4480> <WH8659> and gold<WH2091> from Uphaz,<WH4480> <WH210> the work<WH4639> of the workman,<WH2796> and of the hands<WH3027> of the founder:<WH6884> blue<WH8504> and purple<WH713> is their clothing:<WH3830> they are all<WH3605> the work<WH4639> of cunning<WH2450> men.

But the LORD<WH3068> is the true<WH571> God,<WH430> he<WH1931> is the living<WH2416> God,<WH430> and an everlasting<WH5769> king:<WH4428> at his wrath<WH4480> <WH7110> the earth<WH776> shall tremble,<WH7493> and the nations<WH1471> shall not<WH3808> be able to abide<WH3557> his indignation.<WH2195>

Thus <WH1836> shall ye say<WH560> unto them, The gods<WH426> that<WH1768> have not<WH3809> made<WH5648> the heavens<WH8065> and the earth,<WH778> even they shall perish<WH7> from the earth,<WH4481> <WH772> and from<WH4481> under<WH8460> these<WH429> heavens.<WH8065>

He hath made<WH6213> the earth<WH776> by his power,<WH3581> he hath established<WH3559> the world<WH8398> by his wisdom,<WH2451> and hath stretched out<WH5186> the heavens<WH8064> by his discretion.<WH8394>

When he uttereth<WH5414> his voice,<WH6963> there is a multitude<WH1995> of waters<WH4325> in the heavens,<WH8064> and he causeth the vapors<WH5387> to ascend<WH5927> from the ends<WH4480> <WH7097> of the earth;<WH776> he maketh<WH6213> lightnings<WH1300> with rain,<WH4306> and bringeth forth<WH3318> the wind<WH7307> out of his treasures.<WH4480> <WH214>

Every <WH3605> man<WH120> is brutish<WH1197> in his knowledge:<WH4480> <WH1847> every<WH3605> founder<WH6884> is confounded<WH3001> by the graven image:<WH4480> <WH6459> for<WH3588> his molten image<WH5262> is falsehood,<WH8267> and there is no<WH3808> breath<WH7307> in them.
They <WH1992> are vanity,<WH1892> and the work<WH4639> of errors:<WH8595> in the time<WH6256> of their visitation<WH6486> they shall perish.<WH6>

The portion<WH2506> of Jacob<WH3290> is not<WH3808> like them:<WH428> for<WH3588> he<WH1931> is the former<WH3335> of all<WH3605> things; and Israel<WH3478> is the rod<WH7626> of his inheritance:<WH5159> The LORD<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> is his name.<WH8034>
Gather up<WH622> thy wares<WH3666> out of the land,<WH4480> <WH776> O inhabitant<WH3427> of the fortress.<WH4693>

For <WH3588> thus<WH3541> saith<WH559> the LORD,<WH3068> Behold,<WH2009> I will sling out<WH7049> <WH853> the inhabitants<WH3427> of the land<WH776> at this<WH2063> once,<WH6471> and will distress<WH6887> them, that<WH4616> they may find<WH4672> it so.
Woe <WH188> is me for<WH5921> my hurt!<WH7667> my wound<WH4347> is grievous:<WH2470> but I<WH589> said,<WH559> Truly<WH389> this<WH2088> is a grief,<WH2483> and I must bear<WH5375> it.

My tabernacle<WH168> is spoiled,<WH7703> and all<WH3605> my cords<WH4340> are broken:<WH5423> my children<WH1121> are gone forth<WH3318> of me, and they are not:<WH369> there is none<WH369> to stretch forth<WH5186> my tent<WH168> any more,<WH5750> and to set up<WH6965> my curtains.<WH3407>

For <WH3588> the pastors<WH7462> are become brutish,<WH1197> and have not<WH3808> sought<WH1875> the LORD:<WH3068> therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> they shall not<WH3808> prosper,<WH7919> and all<WH3605> their flocks<WH4830> shall be scattered.<WH6327>

Behold, <WH2009> the noise<WH6963> of the bruit<WH8052> is come,<WH935> and a great<WH1419> commotion<WH7494> out of the north country,<WH4480> <WH776> <WH6828> to make<WH7760> <WH853> the cities<WH5892> of Judah<WH3063> desolate,<WH8077> and a den<WH4583> of dragons.<WH8577>
O LORD,<WH3068> I know<WH3045> that<WH3588> the way<WH1870> of man<WH120> is not<WH3808> in himself: it is not<WH3808> in man<WH376> that walketh<WH1980> to direct<WH3559> <WH853> his steps.<WH6806>
O LORD,<WH3068> correct<WH3256> me, but with<WH389> judgment;<WH4941> not<WH408> in thine anger,<WH639> lest<WH6435> thou bring me to nothing.<WH4591>

Pour out<WH8210> thy fury<WH2534> upon<WH5921> the heathen<WH1471> that<WH834> know<WH3045> thee not,<WH3808> and upon<WH5921> the families<WH4940> that<WH834> call<WH7121> not<WH3808> on thy name:<WH8034> for<WH3588> they have eaten up<WH398> <WH853> Jacob,<WH3290> and devoured<WH398> him, and consumed<WH3615> him, and have made his habitation<WH5116> desolate.<WH8074>
